results.title: Pressure groups in action
results.creator_credit: Marbury Ogle, Cinecraft Productions and Republic Steel Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr Marbury Ogle says that man has always organised groups to help him achieve what was beyond the capacity of one person. In America there are at least 300,000 formal and informal pressure groups, which try to direct, educate and motivate members, to win over the general public and to try to influence the government by lobbying. The lobbyist may act as a valuable informal consultant to a politician while his group may give minorities a chance to express their needs.

group_siblings.title: How our two party system operates
The Role of the Supreme Court

results.title: Our federal constitutional system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
According to Dr. Ivan Hinderaker, the founders of the United States of America questioned whether they should control it. He explains how the American Constitution and the Bill of Rights came about, and claim that there are three main classifications of government: Dictatorship or Democracy? Unitary or Federal? Parliamentary or Presidential? Good use of graphics as an educational tool.

results.title: The Meaning of democracy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr. E E Schattschneider explains the meaning of democracy. Democracy, in his view, is a way of living justly with other people. It is a search for justice and truth. The American Bill of Rights and the system of justice are also discussed.

results.title: How our two party system operates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr Alfred de Grazia explains the role of political parties in the U.S.A., their history, the structure of the major American political party, voter behaviour, and functions of the parties.

results.title: Judy Grinham
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
The swimming career of Judy Grinham turned on her decision, when only twelve years of age, to concentrate on her backstroke, and on her partnership with the great swimming coach, Reg Laxton. Shows her racing performance in the 1956 Melbourne Olympics and the 1958 Commonwealth Games and a glimpse of her private life as well.

results.title: Courtney Jones and Doreen Denny
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Britain’s amateur ice-dancing champions of the world. Shows their graceful partnership in competition events and in nightly practice on a London rink; and in their daily jobs as dress designer and salesperson.

results.title: Pat Smythe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
A film portrait of Pat Smythe, one of the world’s finest show jumpers. A self-taught rider, she has had incredible success in Olympic, international and British jumping events.; three times British sports woman of the year and was awarded an OBE at Buckingham Place. Her own brilliant horsemanship is illustrated. Her spare time is filled with running a guest-house and writing books on horsemanship.

results.title: John Surtees
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
Motor-cycling champion John Surtees in action during different races, and off the track. Shows the strict routine and precision checking behind a race, several races, Surtees at work as an engineer and his family’s contribution to his success, and finally, his transfer to four-wheel (Formula 2) auto racing.
